intro: Crepis conyzifolia, commonly known as the woolly goatgrass, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are covered in dense, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Crepis conyzifolia is adapted to arid conditions and is known for its resilience in harsh environments.
